result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew Michael Dentice

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on December 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

3:38 PM Defendant Matthew Michael Dentice in court.  Attorney Brett E Reetz in court for Matthew Michael Dentice.  Attorney Aleksandra Hodowany. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at Atty Reetz requests doing plea today, sentencing another day. Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea to cts 1 & 3.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of cts.1&3. Count 2 dismissed but read in for sentencing.  Bond remains in effect.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:30 PM  Defendant Matthew Michael Dentice in court.  Attorney Brett E Reetz in court for Matthew Michael Dentice.  Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at.  Atty Reetz advises they have a global offer to resolve both files, requests a plea date be set.  Bond remains in effect.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

by Danielle Hemmerich

Pretrial Release Monitoring Program: Must be enrolled and equipment activated prior to release.  Drug Monitoring.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then take only in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. Maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol except for employment purposes. Not to possess or consume any alcohol.
Signature bond converted to cash bond.

3:15 PM Defendant Matthew Michael Dentice appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  Attorney Brett E Reetz in court for Matthew Michael Dentice.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, reviews State's motion to modify defendant's bond based on ADL violation.  DA Nordin requests modification of bond as stated in their motion. Defense has no objection to bond modification.  Court makes statement, modifies defendants bond from $1,500 signature bond to $500 cash bond.  Same conditions apply as previously set.
Bail/bond hearing on July 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Motion to Modify Bond.      Pamela: Set hearing on this relatively soon. DTE
Status conference on August 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Bond remains in effect.

1:11 PM  Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew Michael Dentice in court.  Attorney Brett E Reetz in court for Matthew Michael Dentice.   Court reviews events in file.   Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.
Status conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
9:30 AM  Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew Michael Dentice in court.  Court reviews events in file.  Defendant files petition for court appointed attorney.  Court appoints Atty Brett Reetz to represent defendant.  Defendant to reimburse the county at the rate of $150 per month.  First payment is due by 6/15/22.  Court reschedules matter to when Atty Reetz is scheduled to be in court.  Bond remains in effect.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:22 AM Defendant Matthew Michael Dentice in court.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, questions defendant on where he's at in getting counsel in place.  Defendant indicates he recently started a job at The Fire Company, doesn't qualify for SPD, requests court appointed attorney.  Court gives defendant petition for court appointed atty form, advises defendant to fill out form and file it with the court before next hearing.  Bond remains in effect.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:58 AM Defendant Matthew Michael Dentice in court.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin.   Court reviews events in file.  Defendant indicates he needs to get some more information to SPD before they can qualify him.  Court reschedules matter.  Bond remains in effect.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 4, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 31, 2022 at 08:00 am.

1:32 PM   Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Matthew Michael Dentice appeared by video.  Court reviews events in file, questions defendant on zoom appearance.  Defendant indicates he doesn't have a license and didn't have a ride to court today.  Court indicates to defendant he lives in Sturgeon Bay, could walk here. Defendant indicates he has 3 kids he watches too.  Court questions defendant on court appointed attorney form he was to fill out and file it with the court before todays hearing.  Defendant explains his dad was trying to help him retain an attorney but that hasn't happened.  Court advises defendant to finish filling out form for court appointed attorney and file it with the court well before next hearing.  Court advises defendant he needs to be in court in person for next hearing, reschedules matter.  Bond remains in effect.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 08:00 am.

Not to possess or consume any alcohol. Pretrial Release Monitoring Program: Must be enrolled and equipment activated prior to release. Drug Monitoring.

11:27 AM Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Matthew Michael Dentice appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.  Defendant does not qualify for SPD representation, requests time to retain an attorney or apply for court appointed counsel.  Court will have clerk send petition for court appointed counsel down with his bond. Bond set.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
